lines.text: Why is Pa always trying to run my life?
Well, after all, he was a corporal in World War I, and you know how bossy they were.
But, Ma, that war's been over for ages.
Not to your father. He loves that war just as much today as he did then.

[seaching his suit jacket pocket for his airplane ticket]
I can't find my ticket!
You can't find your ticket?
[fumbles in her purse]
Oh, here it is, here's your ticket!
I was kind of hoping it was lost.
Maybe you can tell the pilot not to drive the plane too high?
five, four, three, two, one, firing retro rockets!
[presses button making rocket sound]
We will be touching down in twenty minutes.

[whispering]
I have to go to the bathroom.
We have just touched down!

[hands Roy a broom]
Here you are. Now in the mornings you sweep all locker area and boiler room. In the afternoons, you wet down and mop. Now the top of the lockers should be kept... clean at all times. They'll be inspected by me personally daily at 1700 hours. Now in the morning when you...
Excuse me sir, uh, is this all sorta like, uh, part of the training program?
What training program?
You know...
[imitates rocket]
... space.
From there, to there, and I expect you to keep it clean Fleming! Now then...
You mean, I-I-I'm a, I'm a janitor?
Heheheheheheheeheh! Why of course not! My boy, you are a WB-1074 *apprentice* janitor!
Fleming, you've been here two weeks now, and I don't think your mind has been on your work for one second!
Uh, um, well to tell you the truth, sir, my heart really isn't in this.
We are not interested in your heart, Fleming! We want your elbow grease!

[reading sign next to mock up]
"Representation of Lunar Surface"
This here, is what your moon looks like.
Oh...

[steps up onto mock up]
Take a picture of me standin' on the moon!
Aw, that ain't really the moon!
We don't have to tell anybody.

[kisses Ellie at the airport in front of everyone]
Just good friends, Ma.
